Hi Rich,

>Hi Dean, Ko-gatana ( the blades do come in Shirasaya and I have seen the 
>odd one in a lacquered saya and tsuka. Kozuka are the handles actually. 
>I know I am Nit-picking probably but there names seem to get more and 
>more mixed up these days.
>
>cheers
>
>Rich

Thanks for the reply, and yes I know that the kodzuka is actually the
handle, it's just a very bad habit on my part, so carry on nit-picking,
please, so that (a) I'll learn something and (b) I'll stop being a
"nit":-)

Anyway, when you say that you've seen ko-gatana in lacquered saya and
tsuka, what form does the latter take, same-maki, ito-maki or something
else? Also, I presume, the kodzuka mounting is only used when the ko-
gatana is housed in the saya pocket of a wakizashi or katana, or does it
crop up with lacquered saya?

Much thanks

Dean
***
Dean Wayland
